subject: p11569093
History: Right lung empyema after discontinuation of left chest tube.
Findings: Right-sided chest tube has been removed. There is a hydropneumothorax in the inferior right chest. The amount of fluid has increased compared to the study from two days prior. The thick irregular pleural disease around the right lung is again visualized. The left lung is clear. Cardiac and mediastinal silhouettes are unchanged.
